MS file annotations:
[...]: 'Received by me from Mr Wallis on 1st April. | In my humble opinion there is no objection to the adoption of Baron Von Mueller's suggestions. | In absence of President I have infd the Baron and he can take the necessary steps in shipment of the specimens, and have instructed Mr [...] to prepare the requisite letters for signature by President | [...] [...] | 1.4.73'.
[...]: 'Mr Lewis | Have you prepared the letters for signature of President?'.
John Lewis: 'The letter was prepared signed by the A.C. (in absence of the Hon. The Minister) on 8th.4.73 [...] Lewis'. get copy.
Associated letter; Daniel Ploos van Amstel, Consulaat Generaal den Nederlanden voor Australie, Nieun Zeeland, en Tasmanie, Melbourne to J. J. Casey, 10 April 1873: 'I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the 8th inst, informing me of the shipment of 6 Ferntrees by the Lincolnshire for transmission for acceptance by His Majesty the King of the Netherlands I have much pleasure in tendering once more my most cordial thanks for this handsome donation to his Majesty the King of the Netherlands for the Government of Victoria, of which donation I shall have the honor to inform His Majesty by next Mail. I sincerely thank you for the details contained in your letter with regard to the said ferns'. (M73/5636, unit 750, VPRS 44).
MS annotations on Ploos van Amstel to Casey, 10 April 1873:
[...]: 'Mr Lewis | The President desires to know if advice has yet been taken for causing the ferns on arrival in England to be transmitted by the Agent General to The King of the Netherlands. | Let me see [...] papers | [...] | 18/4/73'.
first names Lewis: 'The papers are marked to the Hon: The Resident on the 4th inst. i.e. 73/5636 [...] that cut off has been cut off dealt cut off and other papers 73/4016 get copy cut off with the Secy for Agriculture. A letter should be sent to Agent General by next mail. | [...] Lewis | 19.4.73'.
[...]: 'I have requested the Under Secretary to cause the Agent General to be communicated with. | [...] | 19.4.73'. Melbourne bot Garden

I have the honor to inform you, that in compliance with your instructions six ferns have been procured from Mt Macedon for the Government of Holland, in accordance with the request of Consul Van Amstel. These ferns arrived yesterday at the Spencers Street Railway station, and weigh rather more than five tons. In following up your instructions I have made arrangements for packing these ferns and for their earliest transmission, which can best be effected by the Lincolnshire and through the Gov. Storekeepers Department, should this meet with your approbation. The Lincolnshire sails by the third of April, and the six cases must be therefore on board during the earlier part of the next week. May I request that the Dutch Consul receives official information of these arrangements, and that the Agent General informs the Dutch Government of your Donation, also that it be intimated, that the 6 ferns now sent comprise larger specimens than were ever exported before. I understand, that the best way of transit to Holland is from London by Steamer to Rotterdam and from thence by rail to Amsterdam. Any further instructions of yours will receive my immediate attention
